Reviews.Title: “If you plan to be in room during the day, don't go to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dan b
Reviews.Content: Due to construction of a swimming pool, the jackhammers begin at 9am and continue 'til 5. If you plan to sleep in, conduct business in your room, or intend to merely relax in the room, stay away from this hotel until construction completion...which should be late 2012. I was on the 7th floor, but incredibly, I could not even hear the parties on other ends of my phone conversations. Glass windows shook, desk lamp literally vibrated its way to end of desk every 10 minutes. Hotel made absolutely no disclosure on website or within reservations confirmation. Checked out after one nite of a four nite planned stay. My written complaint to manager days later was met with a reply that, in summary stated, "Sorry and we look forward to your return after construction is done." Really?

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: sofalaman
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with this hotel at all. Nice decor but not my style. No action in the lobby, very dead feel to it. Only one person at reception so we had to wait while she played tour guide to the couple in front of us. I had pricelined it and got it at $90.00 a night for the two of us, disappointed there was no pool. You are forced to pay a ridiculous resort fee of $15.00 dollars, I wanted to decline it since we didn't need the internet and I didn't care about the water in the fridge but you can't you have to pay. We were on the 9th floor the room was big, no great view, beds not so comfy, not enough pillows. I wouldn't go back too many much nicer places to stay with better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mzmeryze
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I booked through Priceline (90.00) and let me just say, I loved every aspect of this hotel. . This is by far the best room I've booked through Priceline. I drove there from Los Angeles and they valet your car. The valet guy was nice. The first thing that hits you when entering the hotel is the harp player. And the grand staircase with chandeliers everywhere. What a nice touch. The service was great. I checked in with ease. They offered apples at check-in. The lady made sure I was aware of the 15.00 free. It was no hidden. And how could it now? After reading most of these reviews. The fee didn't bother me at all. I still got a steal! Very spacious rooms. I loved the separate foyer section before you enter your room. Nice touch. Water pressure was perfect. The knobs on the faucets acted accordingly. HUGE bathroom, closet and separate shower and toilet room. What can I say? I enjoyed myself thoroughly. And it was close to the trolley, which of course I used. I stayed here one night. I will definitely stay here again and again and again....

Reviews.Title: “I can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerryntrevor
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, we had a fabulous stay at this hotel. The moment you step in to the hotel, you feel that you have been transported to Paris. All the staff here are friendly and helpful. We stayed on the 15th floor in a king room. The room itself was very clean and very, very spacious. The bathroom also has a dressing room, making life a lot easier when two of you are trying to get ready. Location is perfect. One block from a Westfield. Two blocks from the Gaslamp quarter and an easy 15 min walk to the seaside village.

Reviews.Title: “Very old world”
Reviews.Author: Sandy2310
Reviews.Content: The foyer of the hotel was amazing, with high ceilings and lots of marble and of course, the obligatory grand piano. The front desk people were friendly and extremely helpful. Our room could have been anywhere from the 4th to 10th floor and we got the 9th floor which we were really happy with. The room was spacious and the entry was not off the main hallway. It seemed that pairs of rooms had separate foyers which kept hallway noise to a minimum. The view was of the city but not an incredibly desirable one. The balcony was tiny (only big enough to stand on, with your stomach held in) but it was winter so we didn't spend any time out there. The room had a feeling of old world charm with plenty of wallpaper and older style furniture. I did get the impression that the room was starting to show its age but that didn't matter as it felt so homely. It also had a separate walk in robe/dressing area, a two bowled vanity basin and separate bathroom containing the toilet and shower. Little extras were the afternoon cookies on the desk in the foyer and fruit in the gym. Unfortunately the new gym wasn't open when we were there in February 2012. The hotel was in a perfect spot, very close to the Gaslamp Quarter and everything you needed to get to was only a train/trolley ride away, with the station being directly outside the hotel. We couldn't have asked for a better place from which to base our exploration of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient traditional hotel in Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: jasmyne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westgate again for my husband's conference last month. Let me first preface this review by saying that I'm more of a Westin than a Westgate type of girl meaning that I really enjoy modern luxuries. The Westgate has a grand, opulent feel, almost as if you were stepping back in time during the Jane Austen period where there are sitting rooms. The lobby has a grand piano, chandeliers, and even afternoon tea! Pros: *Location to Gaslamp, Horton Plaza *Free cookies in the lobby *Gorgeous lobby *Turn down service *Ipod speaker/charger in the room *Free waters Cons: *The rooms themselves though are what I had a little bit more of an issue with. The hardware on the sinks (i.e. the knobs) made it difficult to open and close. *The windows are definitely not double paned for noise, we heard extremely loud ambulences and sirens both nights at 2 am which obviously does not make for very restful nights *The way adjacent rooms are situated is kind of odd. You open a double door to get to your room and the room next door also shares the same front double door. A little bit of a strange set up.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience but Beware of Hidden Fee”
Reviews.Author: dcite2010
Reviews.Content: A quiet European style hotel in turn of the century building with large tastefully decorated lobby and rooms. The desk staff and housekeeping are responsive and friendly giving it a feel of a smaller boutique hotel. Located at the edge of the Gaslamp district just north of Horton Plaza, the hotel is within walking distance of the Convention Center and Petco Park, both about 15 min. Rooms are large, clean and have a large glass window allowing for plenty of natural light. Beds are large and firm, shower spews plenty of hot water. A small refrigerator, coffee maker and large screen TV are in each room. Free internet connection is included along with adequate sized desk for working. Business center is small with a couple of computer terminals and printer available. There is a small fitness center. An upscale restaurant is in the hotel although it didn't seem to be very active as there are dozens of others within walking distance. The only annoyance was an unexpected $15/night "facilities fee" that is added onto the bill on checkout. It made an otherwise pleasant stay a little distasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_NL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week. Very comfortable room, spacious with a good double bed. Hotel is located downtown, with all good restaurants, facilities at walking distance. Had a conference at the conference center. It's about 20 minutes walking, doable.. or take a taxi for around 9 dollars. Breakfast is not a buffet, just order anything you like. Be prepared to take a while for breakfast, service is good but not very fast. Good business hotel so a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: jbol
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Westgate a number of times and always have had a wonderful stay. It's has a very old school european feel which is a nice change of pace from the more modern, boutique hotels around downtown. The rooms are large, comfortable and elegant as well as the bathrooms. I also highly recommend Sunday brunch at the Westgate...my favorite brunch in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: newbees
Reviews.Content: I won a bid on Priceline and got this hotel. I spent time reading the reviews so the parking fees and hotel fees did not surprise me. Checking was super fast, less than 3 minutes. Hotel is 1 block from Westgate. Room was spacious. We really loved the water pressure. Overall, I would hope to go to this hotel again. Btw our room had a mini fridge, coffee maker, hair blower and an iron.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLeesar
Reviews.Content: I found my stay to be fine but nothing spectacular. I have a few minor complaints. First, the front staff didn't know that there was a mailbox directly outside the doors when I asked where I could mail some letters. Second, I like strong water pressure but the pressure in the shower was too strong. Maintenance staff adjusted the shower head but it didn't make that much of a difference. Third, the hotel website needs to be updated about the opening of the new fitness center as it currently says it will be completed in "early 2012". Fourth, I was upset by the lack of recycling in the hotel. There were no recycling bins in the rooms or even the business center. Fifth, I wasn't a huge fan of the decor/style (but I realize that's a personal thing). My biggest complaint, however, has to do with the daily "facility fee" for guests who booked a room via Hotwire or Priceline. There is no need for a $15 daily fee for water bottles (which isn't environmentally friendly), internet (many hotels offer this for free) or the turn-down service. On a positive note, the room was extremely large and it's in a great location (close to a bus stop and a tram stop, as well as the Gaslight Quarter).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: knight2244
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westgate. The staff is friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful, and the location is tough to beat. We booked directly from the hotel, so had no surprise fee, and didn't mind paying what they charged. We would definitely stay there for future San Diego trips. We took the train to San Diego, and the ~5 block walk to the train station was quite nice. We didn't miss having a car at all.

Reviews.Title: “World class”
Reviews.Author: robert43218
Reviews.Content: I found the Westgate online by accident...which was serendipitous. As it is not part of a chain, the property has its own website, but often does not appear in lists of hotels in downtown San Diego where it is located. Nor is it particularly visible from the street, where the entrance is recessed inside an arcade-like entrance, almost hidden by large urns of tropical plants. Given that the building, built in the 70s, has 19 stories of rooms, a large underground parking garage, a main-level floor of shops, and a second-floor ballroom, this is all the more unsusal. The hotel is unique in other ways as well. Modeled after an anti-room in the Palace of Versailles, the lobby and adjoining rooms are decorated in a resplendent fashion reminiscent of the great halls of Europe: giant chandeliers, antique furniture uphostered with period tapestries, chinoiserie, grand mirrors and paintings...and huge displays for fresh-cut flowers arranged in over-sized bowls, urns and vases. Even more remarkable, there is no signage whatsoever: no post-card racks, no magazines, no tourist displays--indeed, nothing that would indicate that his is a hotel in a busy urban locale. Check-in was fast, polite and professional. When I explained that I hoped for plenty of sunlight in my room, the young woman at the desk quietly up-graded me to a higher floor where she assured me there was lots of light and a view as well. Indeed, the room was lovely, once the bell-man ushered me through the small anti-chamber that disquised its entrance. He had appeared curbside when my taxi arrived from the airport, and had spirited my luggage to the row of elevators in the looby where he waited until I had received my key. After showing me around my spacious room, opening the heavy drapes to reveal the stunning view, he disappeared as unobtrusively as he a materialized--all the more astonishing given than he looked like a Thirties moviestar. The room was large, with pale striped wallpaper, brocade drapery, reproduction Louis X1V furniture, fine bedding, and no artwork other than a gilded mirror. The bathroom, which consisted of two rooms, along with a large closet, almost formed its own "wing," with a long vanity and stool in front of the room-wide mirror. The WC included a sit-down shower large enough for two. The Gilchrist and Soames toiletries were in bottles twice the size of most hotel amenities, and they were replenished daily. The hotel's turn-down service is excellent--which I found surprising, given that I don't particularly appreciate the ritual. My first night there, I went to bed early, and missed it. My second night, I came home to find the lights in the room dimmed, environmental sounds playing from the radio, the heavy damask quilt and throw pillows removed from the bed and piled neatly on a stool that must have been hidden in the closet, the bed "remade" with down duvet and three sheets, and two discreet chocolates adorning a breakfast menu on the coverlet. The effect was peaceful and relaxing, and most appreciated after a hectic day. I have never stayed in hotel (and I have stayed in many) where I felt both valued and ignored...in just the right ways. From the moment I arrived, I felt so welcome that I considered myself priveleged; yet, simultaneoulsly, no one approached me during my stay, or interupted me when I worked in my room on the wireless internet, as I did two afternoons Housekeeping was immaculate, but invisible. On the one day when I stayed in all day to work, the head of housekeeping phoned me late in the afternoon to ask if I wanted my room cleaned, and to avail myself of the turn-down service. Somehow, she knew that I had been in my room all day, and had left me alone until she felt obliged to enquire about my wishes. My wish is to be able to stay here again. The dining-room is one of the loveliest I have seen. The food, judging by the two breakfasts I enjoyed there, was original and delicious, the service, once again, impeccable. The small bar is elegant yet intimate...which perhaps summarizes my experience of the whole hotel, where I stayed for one week. How a property of this size manages to run a complicated facility with such attention to detail amazes me...and makes it very rare in my experience of American hotels. And I paid less than I would have if I had booked a Holiday Inn. Go figure. My only quibble about my experience is entirely personal. The Saturday night that I visited the bar to listen to live music, almost everyone there was dressed in gowns and tuxedos ... attending the opera, no doubt, which is near-by, or the wedding reception that was being held on the third floor. These patrons all looked appropriately dressed for their surroundings. In my jeans and sweater, I felt so out-of-place that I left which, no doubt, was unecessary. But I wish I had brought some fancy clothes--which I will do next time I visit. The Westgate is such a fine hotel that it qualifies as a destination in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff; resort fees questionable”
Reviews.Author: jojofliessouth
Reviews.Content: This ornately decorated hotel is in a great location - we walked to Gaslamp Quarter as well as down to the waterfront ,and there is a trolley stop right beside the hotel if this is too much walking for some. Bed was firm and comfortable, shower pressure was awesome, lovely bathroom area, mini-fridge handy, and room quiet. Any staff we spoke to were pleasant, and the room was nicely cleaned and decorated (not our normal taste, but lavish style in keeping with the hotel's theme and fun for a change), with chocolates delivered in the early evening. Yes, we heard some low-level city noise, but, well, it's in the middle of the city, so....no trouble for us. No view from our room, but we were out too much to worry about that. Big perk: We arrived early in the day and were allowed early check-in by helpful front desk / concierge--- much appreciated (and not expected)! We did not use room service, but the prices seemed quite reasonable. We saw some guests enjoying an afternoon tea complete with harpist. I was originally not going to recommend this hotel because of the $15 daily resort fees. I am not clear what these fees paid for, exactly.... We were told this covered things like the spa, coffee, wifi, etc.--- yet most of these are normally included in the regular daily rate of hotels 2 star and up (in my experience). I didn't see a particularly luxurious spa area (correct me if I am wrong...) that could justify the fee. Coffee in room was barely passable with normal artificial creamers, etc., although herbal tea was nice touch. It would be better, in my opinion, just to inflate the daily rate so guests were clear from the onset what they were paying per day. Alternatively, the hotel could add more to justify this fee. (I'm not certain if this resort fee applies to all hotel guests or just those who had reduced rates - we booked through Hotwire..) We likely would not return as we do like a pool/jacuzzi area, and I don't understand what the $15 fee per day pays for. It reads as a bit of a cash grab... If pool/jacuzzi not important to you, the fee is a non-issue, and you appreciate a lavish decorating style (French, 18th century, I think?) this hotel is recommended for location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time”
Reviews.Author: burkeohio
Reviews.Content: Spent three days in January on an upper floor room, facing East. Since our lower level room was not clean at check in we were upgraded. Nicely appointed, good bed, relaxing furniture. Nice view. Bath, particularly the shower, needed to be updated, with new overhead faucet needed. Interesting how two rooms are reached via foyer room from the hallway. Lots of noise when people across from us opened/closed door. Noisy from street noise and sirens in the night. We ate in the restaurant on Friday night. Surprisingly good. Very expensive daily parking. The hotel was built in the 70's and was opulant in its days.

Reviews.Title: “One time occurance made me lifelong fan”
Reviews.Author: BethTulsa_OK
Reviews.Content: I was on business at the Westgate and was pleased with the distance to the convention center; not close, but not so far that it was a problem. The lobby is beautiful and reeks of a long ago Europe; most of the staff was interning from hotel school and it showed. My room was large, the bathroom was gorgeous and there was actually a bench to sit on in the bath area to apply makeup. The entryway from the room to the outside hall buffered hall noise and was much appreciated. All of the above would make the Westgate a lovely hotel and a "hope I get to stay here again" type of place. HOWEVER......what made the Westgate not only special but superior in my mind is the fact that the staff takes the second step. I had asked for a wake up call ( that is delivered by a human voice with a delightful german accent ) but got up prior and hopped in the shower. Didn't even think twice. I didn't hear the phone ring and carried on with my toilette until the door knocked somewhat firmly. Grousing to myself for being interupted, I cracked the door and it was a desk attendant that had COME TO THE ROOM TO SEE IF I WAS OK,,,,,,,,What??? you mean someone thought...gosh....is she on the floor? is she oversleeping etc? Major kudos to the Westgate.......top that Marriott....Westin...Hilton.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jason Y
Reviews.Content: I'm in my early thirties, single and travelling alone to San Diego for a vacation. I booked this 4-star hotel through Priceline for $80, which was an excellent deal. However, upon doing some research I realized there was a $15 resort fee, which includes free bottles of water in the room, wifi and use of their gym. Though I was surprised to hear they didn't have a pool, which I think is unfortunate. I mean which "resort" doesn't have a pool? Parking is also an additional $35, which is on the steeper end. Overall, I enjoyed very much my stay at the Westgate Hotel. I had a room on the 14th floor and away from the elevators as other reviewers had suggested. The rooms were quite, large and felt very spacious, as was the washroom. Some people commented negatively on their beds, but I found them comfortable and they didn't bother me at all. Their nightly "turn-down" service was a nice, classy touch. Besides checking in and out, I didn't have many dealings with their staff but overall their service was friendly, polite and prompt. And finally, the location of the hotel was phenomenal, approximately 2 minute walk away from the Gaslamp district. I would certainly stay here again if I were in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Westgate”
Reviews.Author: Geri C
Reviews.Content: The Westgate is beautiful with a European feel. The accommodations are elegant and very comfortable, the staff is amazing, the food to die for. It is close to transportation and all that downtown San Diego has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: alphabetty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous. It's elegant and descreet and beautiful. It's historic and old...and in the heart of downtown. I LOVE downtown san diego. You are directly across from Horton Plaza, some of the finest shopping in SD, as well as steps from the Gaslamp quarter. All of these are fabulous amenities. My husband and I enjoyed a "babymoon" here before our daughter was born and loved every minute of it. We stayed on the weekend when "downtown" isn't as crowded during the day but is busy at night. The hotel is older and doesn't offer as much sound proofing, so you can hear street noise, and sirens and flashing lights lit up our room a time or two, but it's an urban downtown and I expected that. Our room was HUGE. Massive. Bigger than my first apartment. The furniture was comfortable, the shower large, and overall a great experience. I would NOT stay here with kids. Being that you are in the heart of downtown you have downtown "problems". This is NOT the fault of the hotel. You are only a few blocks from the bus depot, and a few blocks from a homeless shelter, so there are the unsavory types wandering about. The Gaslamp is a playground for the over 21 set, so I'd stick to Sea World area if you have wee ones!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy beds and a resort fee for a business hotel...never returning here.”
Reviews.Author: Forecastdude
Reviews.Content: Most guests could care less about your antiques and want a comfortable bed, free wifi, double sinks a shower that is my above waist level, ice machines available without calling and tipping room service. We checked out after our meeting and went to the Hilton Bayfront for a lower rate that blows this hotel away. Come to think of it most Courtyards would!

Reviews.Title: “Great on the extras. Poor on the Basics”
Reviews.Author: Sleddog8
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. It's definitely old school and grand. The service is very good overall, friendly and efficient. But, the basics in hotel are a room and a bath, and these folks failed on both counts. The bed I had was ridiculously firm, rather like sleeping on the floor. I got very little sleep during my stay. The shower couldn't hold a temprature. It would vacilate between freezing and hot as i tried to shower. So, while it's got some great pluses, the Westgate just fails as a hotel. I'd not go back One negative on the service. When I told the front desk I was unhappy with the room on checkout I got a blank look. When I said I was also upset with her lack of response, I got a very terse 'policy' reply. Makes me think they hear this often.

Reviews.Title: “It may seem like a "Old School" Hotel at first...”
Reviews.Author: MRJMV
Reviews.Content: It may seem like an "Old School" hotel at first by the European decor of antiques and Persian carpets but it is totally up to the minute in service, comfortability and cusine. You'll feel like an aristocat once you stay at this property. Big rooms with overstuffed comfortable furniture and marble bathrooms. Great views from every corner of the rooms in all directions. The room service was excellent. The food devine from the French chef in house. Your situated in the center of it all and easy access to all the sights of San Diego by walking or a shoert taxi ride. I checked out the ball rooms and conference rooms all well appointed and elegant to hold a meeting or special event or wedding. They have a great little gourmrt shop with great deli food. And I found a florist full of fresh flowers in season. Well my stay at the West Gate was unsurpassed in comfort and style in the European way. I will make this hotel my seconf home when visiting San Diego. Thank You West Gate your worth everything you stand for in excellence and style. JMV Dallas Texas

Reviews.Title: “Traditional elegance”
Reviews.Author: Architectandmusician
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, well located in the downtown area. The interior design of the lobby and rooms is traditional and elegant. My room was well-maintained and comfortable. Service was impeccable. I asked the front desk for theater recommendations, and within a few minutes an envelope was delivered to my room with numerous suggestions, printouts and directions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Cspott
Reviews.Content: Designed in a French style the rooms are beautifully appointed and much larger than average. The service is fantastic and the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but feels a bit like the Twilight Zone”
Reviews.Author: TravelRules14
Reviews.Content: The Westgate is all Hollywood 1920's decor. And it is in very good shape, not shabby at all, so it left me feeling like we were in the Twilight Zone. When my friend came to pick us up, he said, "Is there really a harp player in your lobby?" Yep, there was. We got the room on Hotwire for $121 total, so it was a great deal. If you want to be in the thick of the Gas Lamp, this isn't quite the right location - try the Omni, Marriott, or Hard Rock. The $15 resort fee irritated me. The room does have a fridge though, which is nice. The service was good. All in all, this wasn't the right place for us - we like airy, modern places, but I wouldn't object to staying again if the price was right or someone else did the planning. They will be opening a new pool and jacuzzi area in 2012 that looks to be very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Rhumdog
Reviews.Content: Booking on Hotwire can sometimes be an iffy experience. Hotels may give you the worst rooms because of the Hotwire booking. Or some hotels will offer a better room at an additional charge. We understand this because the Hotwire rates are so cheap. At the Westgate, despite getting a great deal on Hotwire, the front desk clerk offered to give us a better room with a better view, albeit on a lower floor - at no extra charge. The service at the Westgate exceeded what we've experienced at many upscale hotels. Room service was quick and the food was excellent and reasonably priced compared to many hotels. We had a minor problem with the DVD remote and called the front desk to report it. Literally within 2 minutes, someone came up to resolve the issue. All staff we met were efficient and friendly. The room was large and comfortable. The location is perfect right on the edge of the Gaslight District. As with any larger city hotel the sounds of the city (sirens, people, etc.) continue far into the night and can be bothersome; however, it's always an individual choice whether to stay at a hotel in that atmosphere. We don't mind it. We'd stay at the Westgate again; perhaps even at full rate if we couldn't get another good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ut_ragazzo
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. There is such a rich history to this hotel. From an outside appearance, the contemporary lines make it seem more of an office building in the downtown lamp district of San Diego. However, step into the ornate lobby and you are transported back to Europe hundreds of years ago! The location is great and the hotel is clean and well-maintained. Rooms are designed to look antiquated with touches of richlieu furniture. Not my style really but it fits the hotel. Mattresses could be replaced as it wasn't the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever had. Bathrooms too could use some updating. No real complaints. I would stay here again. If you're into history, read up on the property before staying. Also - explore the ballroom level at night. It is pretty creepy and ghostlike :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattim1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westgate in October. It is a beautiful hotel with spacious, clean rooms just blocks from the historic Gas Lamp District. Our room had a small balcony, (room to stand) but it was nice to be able to open the large sliding glass door. It is one block from a wonderful shopping area with stores like Macy's and Nordstrom's, yet near plenty of boutique restaurants and unique shops in the Gas Lamp District. My husband had a business conference near the Convention Center, which is within walking distance (six blocks give or take). There are plenty of hotels near the Convention Center, which is also located on the waterfront, but if you want to stay away from the tourist areas, but still be close enough to visit the sites, then this hotel is perfect. Also, the ride to and from the airport is painless, which we really appreciate when rushed to catch a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lagrngrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westgate through Hotwire and before I got there I had read reviews and knew I would have to pay an additional $15 a day fee for water, internet etc. I was pretty upset about that until I got to the hotel. Our room was beautiful and large. There were two bottles of water and a bucket full of ice waiting for us in our room. We had a refridgerator with four more bottles of water in it. The water actually came in handy and I was glad I had it. There was a small coffe maker in the bathroom area with coffee and tea. I made use of that also. The bathroom was very large and the shower pressure was amazing! Our room was very clean. The location was great, easy walking to gaslamp or the waterfront. In the evening they had a nice trio playing music in the bar. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay at the Westgate and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “not great but not awfull”
Reviews.Author: djh2601
Reviews.Content: check in was fine, although the lady clerk seemed to think that i was doing her a favour by staying at the hotel but no big problem really. i asked for a quiet room and had also telephoned a few days before to request the same but when i got out of the elavator my room was right in front of me so i went straight back down and told her again what i wanted she then gave me another room which was only next door to the original room, Hmm was she listening ? but i decided to at least have a look. to enter the room your first enter a small lobby which is shared with the next room so the elevator noise was not an issue. The room itself is of a good size, very clean and had good quality furniture. The biggest let down is the bathroom !!! I last stayed at this hotel about 12 years ago and the bathroom has not changed who in their right mind puts strip lighting in the bathroom, the shower has a massive step up into it and twice i stubbed my toe getting in and out, not the best. however the shower had enough water pressure which can sometimes be an issue. I did not visit the hotel restaurant so i cannot comment on that but I did have room service a couple of times and the food and service where excellent. The door men were all very friendly and helpfull. Please be aware that there are some renovations being carried out in a part of the hotel and although i was on the top floor the noise at times was terrible this started at around 8.00 am and finished around 4.00pm. All in in a nice hotel but not the best that i have ever stayed in but not the worst either. Would I stay again ? not sure I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke...I mean, it's hilarious”
Reviews.Author: honfatboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, old, old. Here on a business trip, none of the others were bothered by the time-capsule feel, but I was. This is not to say it's not nice, or wasn't nice at one point. It really is a garage-kept old lady's car--almost as good as new but obviously not modern in any stretch. They do have flat-screen tvs, DVD players and refrigerators, but that's about it. The rooms are huge, and it is a full-service hotel. Facilitates fee for gym, wifi and water/coffee is $15. Parking is $30/day. NO FITTED SHEETS--which means that the flat sheet won't cover the mattress, which means that your feet are sleeping where everyone else's feet have been. Super gross! And the beds are hard. I wouldn't stay here again, but it is a great location, and it is the biggest hotel room I've ever been in for the price. And again, the other three on my trip didn't find it to be as old as I did.

Reviews.Title: “The Westgate, a Pleasant Hotel, with a Great Location in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: rottnestwa
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed for 4 days at the Westgate Hotel in the Gaslamp. I did not specifically select the Westgate, but we stayed there through Hotwire (and we received a great rate). THE GOOD: Fantastic location. Rooms have sliding glass doors to the outside that make for nice views and breezes. Good rates (through Hotwire) THE NOT SO GOOD (not actually bad) The hotel is very dated. Examples include the dated room furniture, the dining area, and the 'bar.' I use quotations, because you have to see it. Once we stopped by and there were 3 senior couples, and one was having tea. Nothing wrong with that, but it was Friday night. Also, no pool, and what they call a gym is a few stationary bikes and a little more. HOT TIP: They have a whole deck area with chairs, and when we asked the front desk, they said there was no such thing. There is, and it has a fountain, and we were the only ones out there.

Reviews.Title: “Can You Say WOW!!??”
Reviews.Author: otter44
Reviews.Content: I didn't know much about The Westgate when I booked our room. It was a conveniently located to the Gas Lamp District and the airport. Built in 1970s it is a step back into history. The hotel shines with an old world feel. It has quite a history which I found very interesting. The Hotel was well appointed for everything you would need on a trip to San Diego. It reminded me of a hotel I stayed in in Amsterdam. it was a combination of French Provential with a definate European flair. I guess at one point it was "the most expensive hotel in the world", I can believe it. Cons, the bed was rock hard and didn't lend itself to a good night sleep, actually quite the opposite. That's really it... but it is a big CON!! Pros... the shower was the best one I have ever taken!! I don't know how they make water so soft... The view was extrodinary!! If you want to impress someone this hotel will do it!!

Reviews.Title: “More than expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ladycanuck16
Reviews.Content: We came off a cruise at 9 AM, and arrived at the hotel at 9:30 AM. Not only did they allow us to check right away, the Concierge personally escorted us to our room showed us all around, and then opened the floor to ceiling windows wide to show the view right down to the harbor. The room was gorgeous. We went to the bar at Happy Hour to have a drink, and were really disappointed that we had not chosen to have the appetizers as well, as we had dinner plans elsewhere. Every appetizer that was brought past our table looked like a work of art. And from the conversations, tasted as good. Excellent location right across from Horton Centre and one block from Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AB31
Reviews.Content: We arrived on an early flight and went by the hotel to see if we could drop off our luggage. Lorin at the front desk was very accomodating and we were able to check in early. LOVED the room. I was surprised at how large the room was. The furnishings looked new and the room was spotless. I am very finicky about cleanliness and usually won't walk barefoot in a hotel room. No problem here. The bathrooms are also large. The bathroom was separated with a toliet and large marble & glass shower in one room and and a sink, dressing area and closet in the other. Very nice & very clean. The location is great also. We were within walking distance of the waterfront and the public trolley stop is around the corner. Hop on the trolley to go to Old Town. There is also a mall and a Starbucks across the street. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Megyxu
Reviews.Content: Without knowing San Diego we choose this hotel for its location, near to the Gas Lamp quarter. The hotel is decorated at European classic style, high ceilings, big chandeliers, French sofas…even a piano. When we arrived they couldn’t find our reservation with booking.com but they maintained the price that we had in our printed confirmation. They were very attentive given to us all the directions and tips to enjoy our day in San Diego. The King room was big and clean (some stains on the carpet but you have to look for them, I did because I’d read a review talking about it ), window from floor to ceiling given luminosity to the room and a little balcony. The bathroom was huge with a big tub and shower, the pressure was correct even some times to much if you don´t regulate the faucet. I liked the idea of separate the tub from the lavatory and the dressing table with a slide door. We share a main entrance with another room, and after that you find your door at from of the other, this could seem fine but it isn´t because you feel all the entrances and exits for the other room and at midnight is a little bit unpleasant. The breakfast was a little bit estrange, seemed that the waiters were new there. The table hadn´t got all the service on it, and we had to ask for them several times. The things that we order arrived little by little but everything was ok, the best thing was the fresh orange juice even the waiter spilt a little of mine on the table.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Allamur
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Very stylish, with old time European sharm! Wonderful restaurant, very nice brunch with live piano performance. Everything was charming and remind me a little of "Danielli' in Venice. Glad to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your property. Great location, Rooms dated; Good staff.”
Reviews.Author: caineuk1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels all over the world and for the last 5 years normally stay in Hyatt's, Starwood's and Hilton's. As I know what to expect and exactly what I am going to get. The Westgate was my bosses idea, due to it being a little cheaper than my suite at the Sheraton; which I was very comfortable in. The Westgate has a pretty decent lobby; seems quite inviting, though getting into the rooms is a big letdown. They were generally tired with stains on some carpets and seats; the pillows had definitely seen better days. The gym though small had most exercise equipment. No pull, and occasionally I had too remind staff that I had called for room service, etc. Free internet which is excellant (saves $15 a day or so) Staff in general were pretty helpful, though not all that engaging except in the bar and front desk. Basically its no match to the hotels I normally frequent on long business stays. Lastly the additional fee's & taxes stink !!! After 23 days of staying at the Westgate, I will probably not stay there again as San Diego has a lot of hotels in equally decent locations.

Reviews.Title: “never eveer go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim1370
Reviews.Content: I searched for many hotels in the site in the downtown area,as you know downtown is the place where you can reach everything easily so my aim was to reserve a hotel in downtown,unfortunately other 3,4 star hotels have no room so i was kind of forced to get this hotel yes the location is great but the hotel... when you enter this hotel the smell of old stuff is noticable and the hotel staff are young and it is obvious that they are not experienced! i should warn you that they charge you an additional 15dollars each night for coffee,tee,water,internet and phone call and its obligatory and not optional! so try to book other hotels at this price

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vilmar A
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on priceline for a July 2011 weekday stay for around 90$. Another person we talked to got it for around $100 or so. It's very old-fashioned with lots of stuffed chairs, marble, and plush carpeting, not typically our taste. But our room was spacious, the water pressure in the shower was excellent, and our oversized sliding glass doors opened up on to a city view that was wonderful. For the price it exceeded my expectations. Right across from mall found it a convenient headquarters for exploring san diego. Only downside got stuck brieflly in elevator and they waived a hotel fee for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaNorton
Reviews.Content: I was really worried when I got this hotel on priceline for $125 a night and then read the reviews! I was also nervous that we wouldn't survive without a pool. I phoned the next day to make sure we had two beds in the room (our kids are 6 and 3) and the staff were very polite. On our early arrival we were greeted by the fabulous concierge who gave us a brilliant map of the area. Our room was ready and we were really happy with it. It was large and very clean. I must say the shower was the BEST shower I have ever used in a hotel. It was so powerful it almost hurt! Loved the bath robes too. Yes we did pay the $15 extra a night for the "facilities" fee, but we had loads of apples, cookies, bottled water EVERY day. The kids enjoyed their chocolate on the pillow every night too. You also get a newspaper and internet included. The location of the hotel is great. It is next to the trolley stop, which we used to go to Sea World, Balboa Park and the Zoo. You can walk to the gaslamp district, the mall (almost next door) and down to the sea front. There was so much to do and see in San Diego that we didn't have time to even think about going to a pool, so we didn't miss one. If you get this hotel on priceline/hotwire don't worry, we had a wonderful time and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: greggfi
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying I have yet to stay at this property. I am reporting based on an interaction I had with the hotel after I made my reservation trough Priceline. I booked two rooms for a weekend in November for an incentive trip for my employees and contacted the hotel to let them know I would need two beds in each room. I was told they could not guaranty that. The only two options I had were to pay full rack rate of $200 (my reservation was for $100 through priceline.com) or to pay $25 for a roll away bed. I was shocked! I told the front desk clerk I am a Platinum member with Starwood and I had never heard of being charged for a roll away and her response was, you should have booked with Starwood then! I was shocked and hung up! Unfortunately priceline.com will not refund the reservation after this hotel basically bait and switched me. Please make sure you ask questions upfront. Also I hope that the front desk clerk's attitude towards customers isn't in line with their other employees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby but Rooms Not Worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A
Reviews.Content: The hotel from the outside looked amazing and then you enter into an amazing lobby and I felt like it was going to be a great stay. I book the trip on Priceline.com after looking on here and I was excited because I thought I got a great deal. Paid $130.00 per night which is amazing but when I went to check in there were $100.00 in extra fees for 2 nights. Was not to happy with the extra fees. When i got to the room it looked and smelt VERY old. The carpet was stained from what looked like a water leak. There was mold along the back of the sink top and in the shower and it just looked like no one had actually done a GOOD cleaning on the room in about 6 months. When we got ready for bed we pulled back the 1960's comforter and found stains on the sheets and i'm not sure what it was on the pillow case but i know it was not an old stain... it looked like something was just spilled on it. I felt like for the money they list the rooms for we should get something that is clean and free of mold and stains on the linens. I would not recommend this hotel. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that are MUCH nicer! The one thing I was happy about was I had always heard that it was very noisy but i did not hear a thing over night so i was happy!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: RADARSHE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions for business and once with family on vacation. If you are watching your budget, this may not be the hotel for your next trip. This is a hotel from a bygone era. Don't let the modern facade of the building fool you. As soon as you enter the hotel and make your way to the reception desk and see the vaulted ceilings and furnishings, you can feel yourself going back in time. The front desk staff is most attentive and often have people from all over the world working there. They are quick to help and guide you on any question or concern. The location is right in downtown San Diego. You can walk to most anything. Shopping, eating and site seeing can all start from this location. Restaurants abound at all prices, cuisine and ambiance. Shopping is nearby and again in different price ranges. When you step off the elevator and circle around to your room, you know you are in a very nice hotel. Each two rooms share a single "keyed" entrance to an anteroom. Then you enter your own room. Spacious is the word. The decor is beautiful. Everything in its right place. The bathroom is as big as you will see. Comfortable bed and heating/air-conditioning. I haven't used the hotel eating facility, because of the large number of choices nearby. I would recommend Maria's Mexican Restaurant at 1011 4th Avenue. It's a hole in the wall, but the people are very nice and the food is quite good. The workout room is well maintained with good equipment. The USS Midway is a "must see." There is a showroom with restored cars (for sell) in the wonderful gaslight District that is well worth visiting. I would not hesitate to stay here for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel located in great area”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: This is a very luxurious hotel located in San Diego's Gas Lamp district. There are tons of shops and restaurants within a couple of minutes walking distance of the hotel. All the other reviews are quite right about this place. There is a resort $15 fee which gives you free internet ... I found the $32 Valet parking a bit high, but the service made it worth while. Don't bother looking for cheaper over night parking as you are most likely not going to have much luck. I looked for a self serve 24 hour parking for about 30 minutes and gave up and valet parked the car. Overall this is a very nice hotel if you are willing to spend $250+ per night. I would compare this to a Fairmount hotel in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fair123
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised me. Exceeded my expectations. Check in was a breeze, rooms are very well sized, clean, and generally very well appointed. A TV built this generation would have been nicer, along with a shower head from this generation. However, everything else worked very well and was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “More negatives than positives”
Reviews.Author: Padparadscha
Reviews.Content: I will preface my review by mentioning that I am a very experienced traveller and have stayed at several downtown hotels. I got this hotel through Priceline, otherwise I never would have chosen to stay here. This is the most inaccessible hotel that I have ever stayed at. We arrived by car and circled the hotel looking for the non existent circular drive and entrance. Needless to say, there was none. There were several cars stopped at the main street entrance (and no valet or or concierge in sight) so we had to stop the car a bit further from the hotel to unload our luggage. Then we had to look for parking. On the night that we arrived, there was a wedding at the hotel so we had to drive around several times to find a parking space. Hotel parking is costly at $32 (not the most expensive parking that I have ever paid), but there is street parking -- IF you can find a spot, and IF you are comfortable walking back to the hotel on sidewalks that are occupied by the homeless. On top of that, the hotel charges a $15 resort fee for conveniences that are offered for free in many hotels such as Internet access and water. And there are only so many calls that I can make a day -- certainly not $15 worth. Now for the positives -- the room was clean and the front desk staff were very helpful. Some may describe the hotel as classic and charming -- I call it inconvenient and overpriced. There are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting old world Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TimBudi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just for one night on Sunday before labor day. We booked it via Expedia / Hotwire unpublished rate listed as a 4 star hotel in North Gaslamp/Horton plaza area. . I was surprised when I saw the hotel name and anxious to see what we got. It turns out this hotel has it's old charmed and situated in great location. The lobby has a lot of european flavor with chandelier, drapes and flower arrangements. Harpist plays during afternoon tea. Check in was easy, and expect to get a "magnet key" not a card key. The front desk staff were really nice and friendly. You will need to enter the foyer which lead to 2 guests room one on left and right. Our room has a king size bed (double bed costs $20 extra), large size room with sofas, chair and office desk. The sliding door to the juliet balcony is not a double pane, so a bit noisy. There are some stains on the carpet, but it was dry and no odor, just for 1 night, i didn't really care. the bed was ok, but the pillow was too soft for my taste. Our room has a tube TV not a flat screen TV. The bathroom was very interesting. Marble wall and floor, square tub, a nice shower with great water pressure. The hotel shampoo and soap were nice and very flowery. We opt out the turndown service by placing the privacy card outside our door. Yes, there is a $15 + tax = $16.88, charge per day for internet, bottle water and gym. We park our car on the street so we did not have to pay extra $32 for valet. Overall this hotel is good, but old. The room is clean enough although you can see some dust over the brass ornaments. It will be very time consuming to really clean those stuff. To those who like a hotel with european flair, you will like it. To those who like a modern and sleek hotel, you will probably disappointed. So, be careful when you booked via priceline, or expedia / hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: bphawk64
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru Priceline and got what seemed like an incredible price for a beautiful hotel. The hotel was beautiful and centrally located. The lobby was quite impressive with an old world staircase, chandaliers, etc. Our room was also equally impressive..very large with beautiful draperies, large bathroom, etc. The service in the hotel was also quite good and the manager took the time to sit down with me and map out everything for us. She didn't have do to that and seemed quite happy to do so. The front desk staff were also friendly, check-in was fast and easy, etc. The only drawback to this hotel are the extra charges you most likely won't realize are there until after you have booked your room (or even arrived). If you have a car you will be charged $15 per day for valet parking and there are no other options. You also will be billed a $15 per day convenience charge which includes wi-fi, the gym, bottled water in your room, etc. The convenience charge is not optional and you will pay it up front whether you are planning on using those services or not. That said, adding $30 to my priceline rate made it not such a bargain after all. Very nice hotel but keep in mind that you need to add $30 per night to your published rate when comparing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An odd but nice place - a mixup with reservation resulted in nice upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Docallen1
Reviews.Content: We have an adult son who is quadriplegic. Naturally, we are quite specific when making reservations in that we require a fully accessible ADA room with roll in shower. When we arrived, they had put us in a regular room. The bellhop commented on this before we did, and went back to the lobby himself and returned with the hotel manager who apologized profusely. We were informed that the only fully accessible rooms they had available were designed for 2 people (we were 4), and he offered us an executive suite on the 18th floor with a bay view as his best option for us. The executive suite was not ADA, but was roomy, and as we were there for just one night, we felt this was a reasonable accommodation, and at least reflected some concern on behalf of the staff. From the inside, the hotel appears to have been built 100 years ago, but I was told by the manager that it was built in the 1970's. This gives it a bit of a quirky quality, but once inside, it does harken back to fine hotels from a bygone era. Rooms were very clean, but part of the vintage "charm" is that the beds are the standard quality beds, not the upgraded beds one finds in similar hotels these days, but they were certainly comfortable enough. In the suite, the jacuzzi tub and shower were great. Decor was traditional, but tastefully done. As many other reviewers correctly point out: be aware of the $15 resort fee and $32 parking fee - so add $47 to that great deal you found on price line or hotels dot com. The location was great. It is next to the Grant Hotel (worth a walk through the lobby) and across the street from shopping and restaurants. Zoo and parks are short drive away. Overall, we had a nice stay. If the price is right we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissBinksUk
Reviews.Content: Without doubt part of our enthusiasm for this excellent hotel was that we got our room for a fabulously reduced price through Hotwire but even so, this hotel was great. Excellent central location, huge room with floor to ceiling windows that open fully, good bathroom, spotlessly clean etc. etc. If you can get a room for a good price as we did the amenities charge is neither here nor there and although paying for wifi and water which is, as other reviewers have pointed out, provided free in other good hotels, can seem a bit much, the delightful atmosphere, incredible decor in the lobby and the highly efficient, very pleasant staff make it very much worth choosing.

Reviews.Title: “All glitter and no substance”
Reviews.Author: Ethel320
Reviews.Content: While staying at the hotel, the movie "Caddyshack" was on TV, which was an apt metaphor for the Westgate. Much like Judge Smails, this place was all show but no heart. The lobby is grand and opulent, the rooms have fancy draperies and ample space, but the things that count aren't there. The beds are uncomfortable, the sheets feel like the kind you'd find at a 2 star hotel, and the amount of extra charges cancels out any deal you might have. A $15 "facility fee", gets you, as far as I can tell, access to a printer in the business center and a couple of bottled waters. Parking is only valet, and is $32 a night. Almost $50 of charges for things that are included at a Hampton Inn seems pretty unreasonable. Where's Al Czervik when you need him?

Reviews.Title: “Wow I got suckerd on this one.”
Reviews.Author: RebelKnight
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Most the bad points of the hotel is beyond their control. If you are looking for a hotel gift shop that 99% of the world cant buy from because of the cost. Then this is your Hotel. There is a list of all the famous people that have stayed there. A better and I am sure larger list is one of those guests that never come back. The Good +++++ The hotel is beautiful. The lobby is immaculate. +++++ There is a balcony in the room. Also there is a terrace that you can hang out on and over look the area…..See below for the bad part of the terrace. The Bad - I would say in all my travels I have never seen so many bums per square foot in my life. there is a parking lot less than a block away that they line all four sides of the square. ---- They charge $15 a day for a resort fee. On top of $32 a day for parking. Westgate if you are reading this why not accept a $5 bid on Priceline and then charge $75 a day for parking because nobody in there right mind would park off property. ------- The hotel parking is very difficult to get to. You have to turn into a road that says do not enter except hotel parking. You turn onto a road where the trolley goes. ------ The terrace runs along the front of the Grant Hotel. As we were walking around looking at the street below we realized that you can see into the windows of the Grant. So we tried to stay away from that side of the terrace so we wouldn’t be accused of being peeping toms. Just a heads up so you are not walking around and shocked at peoples inability to close blinds. ----- We were completely nickel and dimed here. *****This isn't a reflection of the hotel. It is beyond their control. Just a heads up.********* There is a large amount of homeless people in front and all around the hotel. We are not uncomfortable around them but I am sure there are a lot of people who are.

Reviews.Title: “fit for a princess! i'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: delphine1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2011, with a friend, for a girls getaway trip. The hotel is so, so pretty and made us feel like we were in a fairytale! The room we stayed in had two queen beds and so much space. The dressing and vanity area and separate toilet/shower was a bonus for two girls to get "done up" for the night. I am very picky about cleanliness, and the hotel was clean. The hotel seemed quite and we noticed that many pilots stay at this hotel. We enjoyed how it was close to the gaslamp area, but not too close to hear the nightlife noise. The hotel had a nice high tea, but it ws more of the ambiance we paid for than the savory tea course. The only downfall of the hotel is the extra resort service charge we paid... we were not sure what we were paying for. The night time "turn down" service was included in the fee, but for two girls staying out all night it wasn't worth it. Unfortunately the resort fee is not optional. I think this is a great, central hotel for families, singles and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm w/New World Glitches...”
Reviews.Author: 1SmartCookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Westgate for three nights last week (Wed, Aug 17 - Sat, Aug, 20). I attended a two-day class at the hotel... the elevator commute was fantastic!! I booked an early flight from Denver to San Diego with the intention of spending the day in LA. We arrived at the hotel around 9:30 am and I requested an early check-in. The woman at the front desk was most accommodating and checked us in right away. I'm an Expedia Elite Plus member and this was already noted in my hotel record; so, we received a room upgrade to the 11th floor (Rm #1188). The room is situated along 3rd Avenue facing The U.S. Grant Hotel; an OK city view with one king bed. I don't find San Diego to have a spectacular city view, so a bay view room may be better (it was not available). The room was quiet at night, not much street noise; basically because we were on a higher floor. The light beaming through the sides and bottom of the door to the room wasn't too distracting. It served as a night light of sorts to help navigate my way to the bathroom. (^_^) Maid service was good, as it should be... our class broke for lunch at 11:15 and when I returned to our room on both days, the room and bathroom were spotless. The only thing that was a bit disconcerting (as mentioned by a previous reviewer), is that the maid will knock, then immediately start to open the door. This happened during the day and again at night. One night, around 9:30 PM , the maid knocked on the door to inquire if we liked our turn-down service. Uh, yes... thank you... good night!! The other thing that didn't make sense was having the Afternoon Tea right in the middle of the main entrance lobby of the hotel... As I was heading to the Business Center from the elevator, I had to negotiate tables which was a bit distracting to the diners to say the least. And I had to move through the tables again to leave the Business Center and exit through the front door. Not a well thought-out plan for the flow of traffic for both dining guests or hotel guests. Although I was prepared for the $32/night valet parking and the $15/day resort fees; the parking fee is still pretty exorbitant. I know the GM will say that is standard for San Diego; however, I would expect the valets then to be present 24 hours a day. On Thursday night after returning from dinner, a valet was not outside, so my husband actually parked the car himself (which surprised the valets in the lower level [LL] of the hotel when he pulled in)!! After that, we just parked the car in the LL ourselves. I liked the convenience of printing our boarding passes from the Business Center. The copies go to a printer at the Front Desk, then are delivered to your room. Instead of waiting, I went right to the Front Desk to pick the copies up myself. The hotel is right across from Horton Plaza (the mall hasn't changed much since 1999) and within walking distance of several restaurants in the Gaslamp District. Dinner suggestions: Gladstone's (PCH1 and Sunset Blvd), Vigilucci's La Jolla, and Cafe Sevilla in the Gas Lamp District. Although we enjoyed The Westgate, when visiting San Diego again, we'll stay elsewhere. TMB

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Cspott
Reviews.Content: Designed in a French style the rooms are beautifully appointed and much larger than average. The service is fantastic and the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy and sumptuous”
Reviews.Author: KKSVACAY
Reviews.Content: Very upscale hotel, we enjoyed it alot. Easy to walk to Seaside Village and shops. Not on the beach, but in town. The rooms were very large with beautiful color schemes / decorating. If it was on the beach, we would come again - we were part of a large family reunion and reservations had already been made.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Room, but LOUD at night!”
Reviews.Author: Neutrogena06
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely and had a balcony with a great view, but with the street noise at night, it was impossible to get any sleep. I know the hotel can't control this, but if you are staying one night I would say, suck it up and be sleepy the next day. Location is fantastic, we took the trolley from the train station and walked to everything. The Gaslamp is blocks away. There is also a Coffee Bean within 2 blocks. The hotel was spendy, even with the sale price we paid but for an anniversary, it was perfect. Bring earplugs and you are good to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great outcome; Work within the 'system'; Things to consider”
Reviews.Author: wlschwartz
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Traveled with 2 young kids. Priceline booking-great rate ($90) just before Comic-Con. Amazing location. Be ready for extra $15++ for 'facilities fee' and don't complain - be prepared for it. But, for a large city, downtown hotel, wired & wireless plus water plus newspaper - the amount is not bad when you are paying a low room rate - many hotels charge this for just Internet. Also, if you have a car, expect to pay $30+ per night. However, many ways around it with minimal hassle. I used street parking the entire visit and spent less than $15 for a five day visit (incl weekend). The decor is truly Europe. Very tastefully done, would not decorate my home that way, but very nice. Rooms were very large, great bathroom with good shower/sink pressure, counter space, closet space, drawer space. Booked on Priceline since Comic-Con made room availability very sparse (and expensive). Got a great rate. After booking, I called hotel directly and placed a request for high floor and double beds, and informed we'd be arriving early and requested an early check-in.Front desk did not promise anything, but included the details as a request and mentioned nothing about extra fees. We checked in on a Friday. Arrived at 11:00am. Was promptly informed the room was not available and a double bed was not a high probability. Stated the contracted room via Priceline is a King Bed only. We traveled to San Diego mainly for the kids. We were busy almost the entire day leaving early and returning after dinner time. So, "staying" in the room was not our plan. We knew there was no pool (big negative), but we would not have had time to use it if there had been one. So, keep this in mind for this entire review. We jetted off with good recommendations from the lovely Indian concierge woman (already forgot her name - sorry). We returned to the hotel after 4 PM and the room was ready. The Front Desk CAME THROUGH BIG TIME!! Gave us a room on the 16th floor - not facing much of a view, but no problem. Gave us a room with 2 double beds. Made it a point to inform we with a Priceline booking, the hotel was not obliged to give this type of room without any extra fees. We did not argue and we did not 'fight' for this when we checked in. We were calm and accommodating, and I think this helped tremendously. I parked on the street with a coin operated meter for 2-hr parking. Once Fri at 6 PM hit, parking was free until 8 am. Returned at 8 AM to add coins until we were ready to leave for the day's activities. Street parking is all around (best is off 3rd near A, or B, or Ash streets). Pay no attention to the many homeless who line the streets starting around 7 or 8PM. They were not aggressive in any way, nor loud, nor beggars. The car was parked in street parking the entire stay and never had any problem with damage of any kind. Be sure to read all meter signs for times and days and restrictions. Have lots of quarters ready or visit the 7-Eleven or Front desk to get your change. Yes - an added 'hassle', but to avoid any downtown hotel $30+/day parking, it was well worth the effort. Parking was never more than a 2 to 4 short blocks walk from the hotel (often with less time than the valet to bring it out front). Once Saturday at 6 PM hits, no parking meter fees required until Monday at 8 AM. Add change in the AM and take off for the day, return after 6pm and no fees again. Negatives... * No pool * No real "action" inside the hotel (restaurant) * Concierge not 'full-time', sometimes would have to wait for front desk staff Positives... * Great Priceline rate * Great Granny Smith apples all day long * Great cookies in the evening (Choco-chip/ Macadamia Nut) * Great location (downtown/ Gaslamp) * Great housekeeping response * Turndown service dark chocolates :<) Must note** - anything we asked for, they delivered (extra towels, shampoo, water) and quickly and with a smile and with courtesy. Loved the proximity to almost everything (freeway close, Gaslamp Quarter restaurants/ bars galore, central to everything. San Diego is spread out, so no matter what/ where you do, you need to drive some distance - might as well be central. Close to airport. Rent your car from Enterprise (off airport location at W Palm St), use the airport Alamo Rent-a-Car shuttle and walk literally across the street to Enterprise - don't tell them how you got there. Then, use the "We'll Pick you up service" for the return ride to the airport. All in all, with many similar circumstances, would stay at Westgate again and recommend it. My wife - who was a huge pessimist before even getting to the hotel - was extremely pleased and wished we had been able to stay here for the entire duration (had Comic-Con not messed things up for us) - poor planning on our part. Thank you Westgate Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: I hate paying $32.00/day for parking. Downtown or not. I hate paying a resort fee. Tip the bellman. Tip the valet. Tip the maid, TIP TIP TIP. Oh, and pay a lot for a room with 2 double beds. I actually enjoyed our stay here. But the overall price is just too much for the experience. I suppose if you are picky about style, you will either love or hate this place. Hilarious that they have a list of "celebrities" that have stayed here, listed in the book in the room. I actually know a couple of the people mentioned. Curious to ask if they know that their name appears in each room of this hotel and or if they received a free stay for the use of their name! I guess they use these names so you feel better about spending $32.00/day for parking. The place is old, but well maintained. The gym is small. The lobby is interesting. They had tea time and I actually saw a bunch of women sitting around having tea and crumpets, in the lobby, wearing large hats, Pretty cool, but I bet it cost them a fortune. We drank the very expensive Nestle water from the room as we paid a fortune for it. And used the gym, as we paid a fortune for it. Wifi worked well. No problems there. Plenty of delivery restaurants nearby. Liked that. Rooms are decent sized. Really liked the bathroom size. Marble etc... They need to fix the main door as there is a HUGE gap between the carpet and the door letting in a LOT of light and noise from your neighbor. Called down for our car and when we arrived for the car, it was not there. Strange for a hotel such as this. Oh, and the room was not cleaned well. We came back to our room after being gone all day and found all the trash not removed. Old coffee cup not thrown away etc... And the very expensive coffee that we were forced to pay for with the extra fee" was not replaced. Had to call and have them replace the coffee. Turn down service was not used as we have two little boys that were already asleep when she arrived. Here is another issue. This place is expensive, right? So when we call the front desk and ask a question, you would think they would be happy to help. They seemed disinterested. Overall, this is a decent place to stay. But you will have to pay for it. For the money, there are plenty of other places, with larger rooms and better service to be had.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Old Europe”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: Mandatory hotel fee: $15/ day (to pay for bottled water and wifi), Two Double Bed fee: $20/ day, Parking fee $32/ day. Plus, taxes on aforementioned fees. For a 2 night stay, expect to pay an extra $100 in fees. The manager reports this is one of Travel and Leisure's World's Top 500 Hotels. Unfortunately, the hotel does not even make it into Trip Advisor San Diego's Top 40. Westgate actually is a nice hotel, but just not as luxurious and opulent as the website and pictures would suggest. The rooms are on the larger size. The mattresses are average. The rooms have a mini fridge and small LCD TV. Best of all, there are "free" chocolates. Overall, I think you'll have a better stay if you expect in advance to pay an extra $100 in fees and if you don't come with high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “After reading other reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Gabby F
Reviews.Content: We weren't too sure about this hotel. Many people wrote wonderful things about it and others did not, but since we had booked on princely we had no choice but stick with the hotel. And we were so glad we had! We weren't surprised by the 36 dollar a night parking charge because since its right smack in the middle of downtown, parking can't be free. We had read about the extra charge for a double bed room, but were very happy that they waived it for us since we explained we could not fit our whole family on a king sized bed. And yes they do charge 15 dollars a day for services you might not use, but we made sure to take our water with us and my husband enjoyed the gym. We would give this hotel a 5 star rating if it wasn't for all the hidden fees. Will surly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “European-style 5-Star Luxury”
Reviews.Author: FlyingT-Rex
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've stayed here two or three times in the past several years and always look forward to coming back. Before I stayed this week, I checked the reviews and was surprised at the number of negative ones...and I disagree with them. The Westgate is beautiful and reminds me of staying in a fancy European hotel. The rooms are large and lavishly furnished with expensive drapes, bedspreads, and chairs. I'm so used to staying in cookie cutter hotels, that the Westgate is a seriously refreshing change. The staff is excellent and professional. The location is great...about a ten minute walk to the waterfront. There is a $15 daily fee for computer use, etc (and I don't like fees either), but if you get a great deal on the price of your room this should not be a deterrent. Parking is expensive, but parking is expensive at all downtown hotels. I think that if this place had a pool it would be considered a five star hotel, so if you can find a three or four star price....it is a great value and a luxury treat compared to other options in the area. On a beautiful day, I recommend walking down to the waterfront and grabbing some oysters, shrimp and beer from Anthony's Fishette (the casual-outdoor side of Anthony's Fish Grotto) and then checking out the Maritme Museum next door. The museum has several boats and a submarine that you can walk through at your own pace.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: nc1701d
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on priceline - admittedly, for a good deal. For those of you familiar with priceline, you know that the whole point is that you pay upfront before you know what hotel you have, but in retrun, you pay the rate you specified plus all fees and taxes. I paid up front. Upon check in, the hotel notified me that they will be charging an extra $15 a night. Not for parking (I was paying separately) but as a "fee" they charge all of their priceline guests. I asked what the feel got you and they said water in the rooms, access to the computer in the business center to print boarding passes, and access to the gym, as well as local phone calls. I said those were amenities that were free in most other hotels and I thought the fee was just the hotel's attempt to recover some of the priceline losses and I wouldn't pay it or signt he agreement to pay it. The hotel manager was polite and professional, and waived the fee for two nights of our stay, but it soured the experience for me entirely. The hotel was nice enough, but they didn't replace the water in the room, the guests next door to us left dirty diapers all over the hallway, the bathroom was tiny and there were no drawers for clothes, there were several other charges and inconveniences that were not major but nonethless irritating. Good location, well-sized room, and the appearance of luxury, but the experience was worse than a solid, well-run Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Generously sized rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: decadork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Westgate for 4 nights in June. Location was good and we were able to get to the harbor, restaurants (Roys in the Marriott was very good) near the convention center, and Gaslamp all by walking 10-20 mins. Cabs would have been just $5-$10 to most places. Bus to Zoo was very convenient, just a short minute walk across the main street. Beware there are homeless people just about every block but we didn't find them bothersome. We got a room on the 14th floor. The entrance to the rooms are quite odd to me. Two rooms share a main French door entrance. Once you open that with the key, you come into a small foyer, then access your room on the left or the right once again using your key. The advantage is that hall noise is reduced but then if your "neighbor" slams his/her door, you hear that too. The room size was very generous. The bed was a bit firmer than typical hotel beds but that was to my liking. The pillows are way too soft. I had to double up on them. There were two comfy sofa chairs which we sat in to read the paper. There was another wooden padded chair in the room which we didn't use. The bench at the foot of the bed was nice for putting on / rempoving shoes. The bathroom was also huge. One sink, large vanity with chair for the lady, plus even more counterspace. There is a separate room for the toilet and the shower/tub. It is a square shaped shower/tub with swinging glass door. The built-in seat was nice to sit down to shave. The toiletries were also of high quality. The lotion was one of the most moisturizing I've experienced of hotel lotions. Unfortunately, our room had the tube-style TV and images appeared quite small if watching from the bed. The in-room coffee was a generic brand. The 2 bottles of water per day was nice to take along with us on outings. The fridge chilled things placed in it, but never really made anything cold. Turn-down service was a very nice touch. My husband found the European style furnishings to be a turn-off partly because they appeared out of date, but I didn't really care. I did appreciate that at least everything coordinated. While checking out, they attempted to charge for parking, though we didn't have a car. They apologized and said they would take that off the bill leaving us with a zero balance (we pre-paid on Expedia). Now that I am home though, I see a charge for one day of parking on my credit card activity so I will be calling them. Overall the stay was good and I'd come back if I were visiting again. By the way, my husband and I love breakfast so we'd like to suggest Cafe 222 (peanut butter and banana french toast is a special) and Broken Yolk to visitors. They were probably a 20 min walk. We didn't mind the walk because it made us feel better about chowing down.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter-wannabee
